title: Gold Experts See Price Going as High as $4,500
text: Gold shot past $1,500 per ounce last week and the Legacy Research inbox is packed with questions about what’s next.

title: Proceed With Caution: 10 Tips For Angel Investors Looking To Fund A Startup
text: Angel investors need to fully understand the startup they're backing before they commit to funding them. Here are the most important things to remember when considering a potential investment.

title: Why It's Wise To Bet That IPG Photonics Stock Will Fall Further
text: IPG Photonics used to be a booming company -- but trade war and oligarchs list have taken the wind from its sails

title: Goldman has a new strategy for beating the market during the trade war
text: Goldman Sachs has a new battle plan for the trade war: buy service-providing stocks and avoid goods-producing companies.

title: Stocks Advance In Trade War Lull; Treasuries Climb: Markets Wrap
text:
Stocks kicked off the week on front foot, with Europe equities rising along U.S futures and Asian shares edging higher as trade-war headlines took breather.
The post Stocks Advance In Trade War Lull; Treasuries Climb: Markets Wrap appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: Yen and bond bulls charge on as share markets falter
text: Yen and bond bulls charged on Monday while stocks struggled again, amid ongoing worries that a prolonged U.S.-China trade war and damaging Brexit could tip top economies into recession.

title: Why the 10-Year U.S. Treasury Yield Matters
text: 10-year treasury bond yields are important indicators of the economy as a whole.

title: Saudi Aramco's first-half net income falls 12% on lower oil prices
text: Top oil producer Saudi Aramco maintained its position as the world's most profitable company on Monday even as it reported a 12% drop in first-half net income to $46.9 billion due to lower oil prices.

title: Oil edges down on lower demand outlook, U.S.-China trade dispute
text: Oil prices edged lower on Monday amid worries about an economic slowdown and the Sino-U.S. trade war, which have led to a cut in the growth outlook for global oil demand.

title: 10-year Treasury yield falls below 1.7% amid trade, global growth worries
text: U.S. government debt yields were sharply lower Monday morning, amid trade tensions between the world's two largest economies.

title: Dow futures drop 150 points as US-China trade, Hong Kong protest tensions rise
text: Market focus is largely attuned to simmering trade tensions between the world's two largest economies.

title: Saudi Aramco's first-half net income falls 12% to $47 billion
text: Saudi Aramco, the world's top oil producer, reported first-half net income of $46.9 billion on Monday, down from $53.02 billion a year earlier.

title: Huawei launches the first product with its own operating system — a smart TV
text: Huawei on Saturday launched a smart TV that would become the first device to be powered by its own operating system, the HarmonyOS.

title: Oil prices slip as demand outlook, trade dispute weigh
text: International benchmark Brent crude futures were at $58.35 a barrel by 0249 GMT, down 18 cents, or 0.3%, from their previous settlement. U.S. crude futures were at $54.29 per barrel, down 21 cents, or 0.4%, from their last close.

title: Asian shares inch up on China recovery, yuan fixing
text: Gains by Chinese equities and the yuan's stronger-than-expected daily fixing helped lift a broad gauge of Asian shares above water on Monday, but firm gold prices underscored investor worries over risks from a prolonged Sino-U.S. trade war.
